intro: Horkelia beneolens, commonly known as the Sierra primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open areas, such as meadows and slopes. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. Horkelia beneolens is known for its early blooming period, often appearing in late spring.
